intro: Gonolobus xanthotrichus, commonly known as the yellow-hair senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Gonolobus xanthotrichus is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
